intro: Cyrtandra filipes, commonly known as the Hawaiian hairroot, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Cyrtandra filipes is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests. It is considered an endemic species and plays a role in the ecological diversity of Hawaii.
